title.narrative: Breast cancer screening baseline and quality management system in in Colombia

description.narrative: The Netherlands and Colombia have an agreement cooperation to exchange knowledge and strengthen public health in the Life Sciences and Health Sector (LSH). Colombia has declared cancer as an illness of national priority, in particular focus is paid to early detection (screening) of breast cancer. The health system in Colombia is largely privatized. 89% of the insurance companies are private and 11% are mixed. 90% or the oncological services are private. The Colombian system lacks standardized procedures and quality control for screening. Main problem is that health providers work under different standards for breast cancer screening. Treatment starts on late stages due to lack of prompt and quality diagnose, which increases the mortality rate (mainly of women). The assurance of quality control and screening at the same standard is an imperative need within the organizations that are part of the health system.The Netherlands has an added value to become a partner to support Colombia on this challenge. The Netherlands screening process is one of the most efficient in Europe. The project enables specialized expert support of a multidisciplinary Dutch team on breast cancer screening in Colombia with the elaboration of a detailed baseline assessment of the actual national breast cancer screening programme during the 1rst phase. In phase 2, the project strengthen the capacity of public sector by providing advice for the implementation of a standardized quality management system targeting on breast cancer screening targeting private and public providers; and training private and public oncology experts to improve the quality of breast cancer screening and diagnosis. The project has a positive impact on:SDG 8: decent (inclusive and sustainable) work and economic growthSDG 3: good health and well-being

participating-org.narrative: Stichting Landelijk Referentie Centrum voor Bevolkingsonderzoek

receiver-org.narrative: Stichting Landelijk Referentie Centrum voor Bevolkingsonderzoek
